intro: Phlomoides szechuanensis, commonly known as the Sichuan phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, adapting to cooler and more arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
